channel.title: Axoloti Won't Stay Connected
channel.description:
Hi there,
I'm trying to boot up my Axoloti for the first time, and am running into a problem. When I open the patcher app, the console window says that the Axoloti connects, then within 1-2 seconds it times out and disconnects. This keeps happening when I click the 'connect' button at the top of the console window, and the output is:
USB device found connected Firmware version: 1.0.0.1, crc=0xE95BAC96, entrypoint=0x20011000 Ping: WaitSync Timeout, disconnecting now Disconnect request
Any thoughts on what I can do to keep it connected would be greatly appreciated. Thanks!

item.title: Axoloti Won't Stay Connected
item.dc:creator: @thomas11
item.description:
@thomas11 wrote:

Thanks for the help. When I tried resetting the firmware, the console said I was missing a file, so after a reinstall of the patcher everything's working great. Best!

Read full topic

item.title: Axoloti Won't Stay Connected
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

is this a new axoloti? or has it been used before?

it sounds like its got a patch running, that its failing to load....
in which case you can hold s2 to prevent it starting.

if not, id do a firmware reset via dfu mode

both procedures are detailed in the 'user guide' here:

Axoloti Hardware User Guide
Connectors and controls 3.5mm (1/8") mini-jack is a headphone output. Use only for headphones (headphone jack is electrically biased at 1.65V.) 6.35mm (1/4") Stereo connector input and output, (labeled on the backside of the circuit board). 5 pole DIN connectors are MIDI in- and output (labeled on the backside of the circuit board). micro-sd-card (should be FAT formatted) micro-usb serves connection for Axoloti software, a power source, and act as a class compliant midi device. power input: 2.â€¦

Read full topic

item.title: Axoloti Won't Stay Connected
item.dc:creator: @thomas11
item.description:
@thomas11 wrote:

Hi there,

I'm trying to boot up my Axoloti for the first time, and am running into a problem. When I open the patcher app, the console window says that the Axoloti connects, then within 1-2 seconds it times out and disconnects. This keeps happening when I click the 'connect' button at the top of the console window, and the output is:

USB device found
connected
Firmware version: 1.0.0.1, crc=0xE95BAC96, entrypoint=0x20011000
Ping: WaitSync Timeout, disconnecting now
Disconnect request

Any thoughts on what I can do to keep it connected would be greatly appreciated. Thanks!
